ygData.subject: Aw: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
ygData.msgSnippet: Ken, you make excellent points. I myself do not trust Facebook for all the reasons you state and more. Besides, not everyone wants a Facebook account. I am

Subject: Aw: Re: [neat] Yahoo Groups is being deleted
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=582345280
From: "Fred Mitchell" <lordalveric@...>

<html><body><div class=3D"mail_android_message" style=3D"line-height: 1; pa=
dding: 0.5em">Ken, you make excellent points. I myself do not trust Faceboo=
k for all the reasons you state and more. Besides, not everyone wants a Fac=
ebook account.<br>
<br>
I am personally OK with Google Groups.<br>
<br>
Or,=
 comma, we can do usenet. :)<br>
<br>
MfG<br>
Fred<br>
-- <br>
Sent from my=
 Android phone with GMX Mail. Please excuse my brevity.</div><!DOCTYPE HTML=
 PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd"=
>
<html><head>







 
<meta name=3D"viewport" content=3D"width=3Ddevice-w=
idth" /><meta http-equiv=3D"Content-Type" content=3D"text/vnd.ui.insecure+h=
tml;charset=3Dutf-8" /></head><body style=3D"background-color: #fff;"><div =
class=3D"mail_android_quote" style=3D"line-height: 1; padding: 0.3em">Am 21=
.10.19, 08:52, "kstanley@... [neat]" <neat@yahoogrou=
ps.com> schrieb:<blockquote class=3D"gmail_quote" style=3D"margin: 0.8ex=
 0pt 0pt 0.8ex; border-left: 1px solid rgb(204, 204, 204); padding-left: 1e=
x;">





<span style=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp=
-text">
      
      
      <p>Hi all, it's an unfortunate development=
 and there doesn't seem to be an ideal resolution, but I would suggest=
 we consider moving to Google Groups.  I hear some skepticism on Googl=
e Groups' own staying power, but I think they are not going anywhere b=
ecause (I believe) many companies use Google Groups internally.  In ef=
fect, Google Groups is a part of a service that Google provides commercial =
users, so I think there's a good chance of it being maintained serious=
ly.  I find Google Groups is also well maintained and functional.</p><=
div><br /></div><div>One other reason to move to Google might be that so ma=
ny people use Gmail and other Google tools that joining a Google group woul=
d feel natural and easy for a new user, whereas joining a Yahoo group is be=
coming anachronistic, and thereby potentially inhibiting the growth of this=
 discussion community. Of course, we do likely pay up front by losing some =
legacy of users, but over time that loss should be overcome.<br /><div><br =
/></div><div>By the way, Jeff Clune also started a Facebook group called&nb=
sp;Evolving Artificial Intelligence & Complexity (which you may also wa=
nt to join), but I am not very happy with the venue there either because it=
 doesn't automatically send group messages to people's feeds, mea=
ning that many posts are not seen by the vast majority of the group's =
subscribers!  A year or two ago, I noticed a change where posts starte=
d getting far fewer views even though the group membership had not decrease=
d, so I don't trust how Facebook runs its groups very much.</div><div>=
<br /></div><div>If we do try to move to Google Groups, should we name the =
group something more broad, like Neuroevolution Discussion Group?  It =
could reflect that the discussion in the group has broadened over time.&nbs=
p; </div><div><br /></div><div>I think such a move could reinvigorate =
the group over time in part by dissociating it from what might be perceived=
 as a diminishing brand (Yahoo Groups).  It is unfortunate to have the=
 topic (NEAT/neuroevolution) conflated with the health of Yahoo Groups itse=
lf, as they really have nothing to do with each other.</div><div><br /></di=
v><div>Best,</div><div><br /></div><div>ken</div><div><br /></div></div>

 =
   </div>
     

    




<!-- end group email -->

</blockquote></div></bo=
dy></html></body></html>
